trans-unit.source: For more information about disks, see [About Virtual Machine Disks in Azure](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=403697).
trans-unit.target: For more information about disks, see [About Virtual Machine Disks in Azure](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=403697).

trans-unit.source: How to: Attach an empty disk
trans-unit.target: How to: Attach an empty disk

trans-unit.source: Attaching an empty disk is the simpler way to add a data disk.
trans-unit.target: Attaching an empty disk is the simpler way to add a data disk.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to attach a new empty disk:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to attach a new empty disk:

trans-unit.source: Replace `vm-name` with the name of your virtual machine, and `size-in-gb` with the size of your new disk.
trans-unit.target: Replace `vm-name` with the name of your virtual machine, and `size-in-gb` with the size of your new disk.

trans-unit.source: You can optionally use a blob URL as the last argument to explicitly specify the target blob to create.
trans-unit.target: You can optionally use a blob URL as the last argument to explicitly specify the target blob to create.

trans-unit.source: If you do not specify a blob URL, a blob object will be automatically generated.
trans-unit.target: If you do not specify a blob URL, a blob object will be automatically generated.

trans-unit.target: Run the following command to verify that your disk has been created:
